alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 6:21PM MST until September 02 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CROOKS FIRE SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 621 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Crooks Fire scar. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Ash Creek, Milk Creek, and the Hassayampa River. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding in and around the Crooks Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Crooks Fire scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Palace Station and Mt. Union. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Middlewater Creek, Turkey Creek, Hassayampa River, Lynx Creek, Ash Creek, Milk Creek and Big Bug Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flash flooding is occurring or imminent! Flood waters carrying ash and debris from the Crooks Fire scar will flood Ash Creek and Milk creeks and enter the Hassayampa River just downstream from the Gold Bar Ranch. Low water crossings, especially along Forest Road 82 will be flooded.
